text: This place has been newly renovated and it's my first time being back since! It looks much more modern and much cleaner. I've always loved the food and now, I'll enjoy it so much more with the great atmosphere. I come here for the pho! And I love it so much. It's very traditional and it's extremely delicious. I highly recommend you come here! Especially during a late night craving! They're open late which is the best part!

I will admit I used to cringe when my husband would tell me we were coming here for or lunch or dinner before.  But now that they have new owners and have remodeled the place and changed up the menu a little, I can honestly say I am actually looking forward to going back.  They have added two big screen televisions.  They now have wooden bench style tables and they play hip hop music.  When we arrived a couple of the waiters were dancing and one even danced us on in to our table (he was feeling it).  I ordered the roasted hen with a side of egg noodles the noodles had a sweet brown sauce on them with a kick to it, and a small bowl of soup.  To my surprise it was rather tasty the roasted hen was seasoned perfectly and crispy but the inside was not dry.  My kids shared the roasted hen and tomato rice place and enjoyed it as well.  My other daughter got steamed rice and beef and broccoli, that was enough to feed two people easy.  My husband got steamed rice with pork and egg loaf.  It was all good.  I also had, well my kids actually had the three bean drink, so good.  Next time I will make sure to order two.

First visit here but won't be our last. Took a chance to eat at another Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas. Love that they offer the table grill. So fresh and good and cooked to perfection because you grill it yourselves. We went with the beef, shrimp squid combo, enough food for 4, so yes, we over ate, but it was worth the calories to the last savory, sweet morsel! The waiter said they will soon open until 2AM.
Good tasty, nice service. Beef pho soup has 6 choice and each one all delicious.Tai tea is also good to drink. I will take my family to eat it again.

Hands down one of the best Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas.  I used to love PS1 now I love it even more.  The newly renovated restaurant is beautiful with modern decor and cozy atmosphere.  But the food is even better.  Bo Tom Muc Nuong Vi and other Wrap & Rolls dishes are phenomenal.  Pho bowls are generous portions with flavorful broth.  Service is fast and friendly.  They can accommodate big groups.  It's the perfect place to go for Viet food when you're in Las Vegas.  It's worth every penny.

OMG! I went in to this restaurant because Pho Kim Long had such a long line. I did not expect the food would be this good. I used to come here a few years ago, but everything from interior to food was top-notch.
We ordered a spring roll and beef combo pho. IT WAS DELISH!!!!!
I am not going to other pho places. It was BOMB!!!

Been coming here since high school. The #1 reason why I keep coming back to this location is because of the pho broth (obviously) but I just feel like it tastes better than any other pho places I've been. 

This place has been renovated and I do like the new decor and look of the place. It feels much cleaner. 

I usually get the combination pho, egg rolls, spring rolls, or the pork chop rice dish. The last time I was here I got the oxtail pho. While the broth was perfect, I wished they had added more oxtail. I was really hungry! 

If you're looking for a good pho place, come give this place a try! You won't be disappointed.

Table was dirty.

Order was taken and got asked by 2 others if I was ready to order so apparebtly no table assignment can make things confusing.

Ordered combo pho... no meat balls wtf, dissapointing.

$10.95, also very pricey for no meat balls.

Broth was ok but it wasnt hot enough to wilt the veggies. A big thumbs down for any Vietnamese restaurant.

Did not get any service after getting my food. I had to walk up to the counter to pay.

Don't think I will return. They seem to nickel and dime you for extras that shpuld be included in thw entree.

I was in Vegas for vacation last week and found this place while craving for some pho. It's in large plaza so lots of parking. Inside actually looks larger and cleaner than what it looks from outside  interior is modern and clean, and service was quick and nice.

We ordered spring rolls and they were so much better than ones here in L.A. the wrap is chewy and not so thin like others and was very fresh.

Pho was also good. It wasn't Wow! but I would go back to this place when I'm in vegas next time.

Always such a good place to eat! The food always taste good, great service, and clean. They're newly renovated now and we waited a while for them to reopen, but the new place looks great! Good decor, roomy, feels comfortable. Tonight I tried their vegetarian dish with tofu, my husband had the brisket and flank pho, and we shared summer rolls for an appetizer. All good! One of our go to's when we have to eat out. It's nice when the servers come around and ask if you're enjoying your food.

It's a must when you're on vacation, gotta have our pho fix! But this place has so much more than pho! It has nam neuang, and we came back just for that! I saw that it was closed for a little bit and just recently opened back with a complete remodel. Much cleaner with a modern farmhouse feel. It's a little further down on Spring Mountain, but not too far, and definitely worth the extra minutes. My son had their pho, I had the bun bu hue, hubby had the pork chop. Pho was good, but not the best he's had. Bun bu hue had good flavor and was hearty. Pork chops were ok and a tad bit small. The nam neuang was the best thing we ate. It comes as a spring roll or a do-it-yourself wrap. Both are good, but you get the crunchy egg roll wrapper in the spring roll. Service was as expected, food comes out pretty fast. Prices are average.

Been a customer since day 1. Soo many memories here. 

I'm excited that the OG owners are back. Remodel looks nice, clean, and modern. Pho is best for any occasion....hangovers, rainy days, breakfast, ANY day. 
Our servers were quick and attentive. The food is delicious, reasonably priced and comes in good portions. Somehow I always order the same thing....pho and eggrolls. I look forward to trying other items on the menu next time.
Pretty good Vietnamese food with a wide selection so you're not limited to pho. Really great service!

Super excited that this place is back open! Love the new decor and service was top notch!! I have 2 little boys and just as I was about to request plasticware and scissors to cut up the noodles, our waiter anticipated our needs and brought it to us along with extra napkins and straws. They offer a wide variety of Vietnamese cuisine that you can't go wrong with anything you order. When I asked my son how he liked his food, he gave me 2 thumbs up and asked when we going back!

I used to be a regular here till they changed owners... This place sucks now. The older waitress is very rude. We ordered the bun bo hue, pho, and grilled beef with lemon grass. They brought a bowl with hot water and waited like 30 mins to bring out the beef and the pho. They took a bit longer to bring out the bun bo hue. The Bun bo hue didn't have any PORK BLOOD, so I call over the owner and said that this soup doesn't have pork blood and she said hold on and sends the waitress out way 5 mins later to tell me they ran out of pork blood and that they put extra ham in it. I tell the waitress I don't want the soup any more since the whole point of that soup is for the pork blood and hat they should have let me know before they made it that they were out of pork blood, and she said it's here now and they put extra ham and to eat it or take it to go. WE WILL NEVER COME BACK!! HORRIBLE AND RUDE MANAGEMENT
BEST VIETNAMESE RESTAURANT IN TOWN. The food is great and very fairly priced. The staff is attentive and helpful. The restaurant is clean and spacious. I highly recommend it!

I do not usually write a review, but a few days ago me and my friends went to this place. I ordered bun bo hue and It was completely outstanding. The secret is the broth. Can not describe it but highly recommend it. Must try if you are the one have a fancy taste ;)
Remodeled good service the soup is not hot me a little Improvement in there other than that very good very good tasty authentic clean.
Best pho noodles in Vegas !!!! If you get the large they're generous with their meats

Greatest service I've ever gotten as an Vietnamese restaurant. They were very kind and attentive. Water is filled before having to ask. Very polite and generally nice people. Got the BBQ beef to share with someone. Came with big plate of vegetables, rice paper, noodles, two sauces and seasoned beef sliced thin. The grill cooked the beef and you rolled your own. The portion is great for two. The pineapple sauce was great! Overall very satisfied with the meal. Other people I dined with also loved their food. The price and portion was just right. The bathroom is hella clean and vibe in the place is nice. Great for groups.

This place has been my go to since forever. They recently renovated the entire restaurant and the place is so modern and clean! Their pho is one of the best in town and my absolutely favorite is their BBQ (nuong vi). They also have broken rice dishes (com tam), vermicelli (rice noodles) and many other traditional dishes. One of the unique dishes they have there is Fried Pho Noodles (pho xao don), I have to get that every time I eat at Pho So 1. If you haven't been there lately I recommend paying them a visit, the original owners are back and the food is great - again!
This place, the family, the food has always been my favorite. I grew up here, the food is pretty amazing and we go to all their restaurants.

I am so glad that this place is back. Pho So 1 had the best pho in Vegas, and they were gone for a little... but the restaurant has a nice new look and the quality of food is still awesome!

My friends and I each ordered the pho tai nam.
Pho So 1 makes some pretty damn good pho, and it looks like they still got it!

I only knocked off one star because during the whole meal, our waters were only refilled once..... at the end of our meal. 

This restaurant always seems to have people in it, and it deserves to. Come here if you want some delicious pho!

Restaurant is nice and spacious. It's comfortable and modern for a Vietnamese restaurant. The menu has quite a variety of food selections to choose from. Had the fried chicken with rice and it was really good. Food came out fast. Service was great. 

The Vietnamese drip coffee was one of the best I've had. Super strong and flavorful. I had to add extra water to lessen the strength a bit. 

No complaints. Highly recommend it. I'd come back!

I was visiting Las Vegas and found this restaurant 
The inside was nice the lighting was interesting
My food was in the ok department as in taste
( bbq pork soup )
I was hesitant to even walk into the restaurant because they have a confusing sign at the door stating that they have no public restrooms but in actuality they do have restrooms 
the sign should say restroom for customers only

The food was AMAZING!! We had the Pho Chix soup and spring rolls made with chargrilled beef. So  delicious. Staff is super friendly. Very clean and comfortable atmosphere. If there were six stars I would give them

I loved dining at this local spot for lunch and dinner for many years since I moved to Vegas in 2000.  They newly renovated the entire venue and it looks immaculate and modern. The atmosphere is still very relaxing and the servers were awesome to say the least.  Kudos to the owners to taking this original popular pho restaurant to the next level. The new menu has lots of authentic Vietnamese dishes. The pricing is very affordable and the generous portions will have make you full and coming back for more.

Great place. Clean and fast serving. We had 1,,2, 7 and 13. Lots of side veggies. 
Love that it was open until 11:00pm.

We went to this restaurant yesterday when we were in Vegas for spring break. The food was OK but the service was terrible. The owner was very mean and didn't care about customers. Never come back for that service

I'm soo glad they are back in business! My family has been eating at Pho So 1 since we moved to Vegas over 10 years ago! we were so bummed that the closed for a few months during the holidays, we weren't sure if they were reopening.. but our family is happy they are back! We love the food! we never have any complaints when we go there! The new set up is nice! Definitely more up to date and modern! we've tried other Pho places, but this is still our favorite!
Always great here. Delicious vermicelli bowls and friendly service. I'm glad they are reopened!

the new pho so 1 changed the cook. majority of the food that i ordered are SALTY.. fried rice is salty, egg roll is also salty. the place looks great though. im just not coming back here again cos food is not great anymore. Sorry.

Excited to finally see that Pho So 1 is open again. The staff here is very friendly and really know how to treat their customers. In addition to the awesome guest experience, their food is top notch. I had the brisket pho and the broth was amazing. If you want the best pho and the nicest reataurant owners on Spring Mtn, you go here.

Came to get some pho and this place is closed for renovations and under new management. 

This is my go to place for pho!

Great restaurant. It was recently renovated and it looks very nice! Their Pho is very delicious! All ingredients are fresh and their service is very good. Parking may be a little tight since it's by a grocery store, but aside from that it's perfect!

Large portion, reasonable prices, food is flavorful and soup broth is on point! Love the new interior design as well! The employees are also very friendly and attentive! Definitely coming back with more friends and family!

It was a rainy day today and the girlfriend and i decided it was perfect weather for some Pho! We always get rare steak and let me tell you t was delicious  the steak tasted well and there was plenty of it. The large is more than enough for the average person. Service was very attentive and location has gone thru a remodel and is looking very nice   if you love pho go check this place out!

Oh my goodness, the delicious aroma of yummy food that awaits you as soon as you open the door to the restaurant is just incredible.  

Egg rolls were delicious and was served with fresh herbs and veggies. 
Charbroiled pork spring rolls- yummy! 
Bun bo hue was so good and so much too!

Came here for lunch per my friend's recommendation.  We ordered an assorted meat pho, a pick-your-own pho and vermicelli, a  rib eye pho.  The soup broth is very tasty with good portion sizes of pho and meat.  We liked the pick-your-own pho more than the assorted.  The rib eye pho was also tasty but the rib eye pieces would lump together if you didn't  separate them before the hot soup cooked them.  The pick-your-own vermicelli has lots of veggies and herbs (the non-herbs eater may find it a little too much), which gives it a unique taste.  Would definitely come back to try out other things on the menu.
i went to there yesterday night.  they closed for renovation. .some one know when they will reopen again  ?

Great place. I was wondering why they closed, but looks like they are open again, which is good!

I had the classic bun bo hue, which is great for a runny nose. It was very tasty, and the broth was flavourful. 

The service was nice. Waters were refilled often!

One of the original Viet restaurants in town I haven't been in a while. Place has been remodeled - new, nice and clean!!! Had Bun Rieu and Crispy Rice Noodles, my favs  Food was as good as I remembered and service was on point. They have drinks with crystal bobas and it's sooo good! Not your typical chewy bubbles, but a pleasant pop of surprise.

Wow this place sure has gone downhill in the worst possible way.  God how I miss the Pho Sol 1 old school days from years ago. This has now become one of the worst Vietnamese restaurants in all of Las Vegas. 

Sure they remodeled and everything looks a bit more modernized but upon sitting down and looking at their new menu, It was immediately disheartening to see not only did they jack their prices up, they decided to go the Ala Carte route with some of the Vietnamese dishes which is so ridiculous especially with rice dishes that used to cost $9.95 are now up to $14.95. 

Our waiter told us they fired all the old staff/cooks/servers and are starting on a fresh new leaf. If this is what they call a fresh start count me out, especially when there are such good and reasonably priced Vietnamese restaurants literally around the corner like Pho 90 and Kim Long. 

The portion was so small for my rice entree dish & meat was full of fat, yet the prices were inflated to the max for mediocre food. Total highway robbery at the Pho Sol 1. Never again!!!

Now the original owners have made it back. The food quality  is better than previous Service is way better than before. We have been going there since they first open the restaurant when it was once side

So glad the original owners are back at Pho So 1! This is the original pho spot in vegas that I tried and loved right off the bat. My expectations is really high moving here from California and they actually exceeded it. Love their pho dishes and their wonderful customer service. Highly recommend this place if your looking for hearty home style Vietnamese food.

Whenever I'm in Vegas this place is the spot for delicious Vietnamese food. Typical Asian restaurant service. They expect you to know what you want to order. Waiter give you a menu and walk back to cashier and than comes right back and ask what you want. Lol like seriously what's the point of handing out the menu. I don't come here for service just for the food.

Efficient and friendly open spaced Vietnamese restaurant with a hipster feel. Then the food O M G! Pho #7 house special combo. Broth is flavorful and noodles a plenty along with the meats. (And that wasn't even my entree!) My Bun, aka Vermicelli Noodle Bowl with Charbroiled Pork & Beef was also super yummy! Love the fish sauce. The Gua Cuon, aka non-fried shrimp spring roll was good, too. Fast, efficient service. Definitely a keeper in our local book. Hence my review and Yelp bookmark! Highly recommend and we're coming back soon!
(One criticism to owners- pls fix the women's bathroom stalls. Very awkwardly configured. My knees touched the stall door and there's room behind the toilet to move it back. Or even perhaps move the stall door out more. After eating, no one wants a bathroom door that close to her face and knees. Lol)

Omg I don't even know where to start. I'm just so happy that Pho So 1 just reopened again. I still remember when I first moved to Vegas 10 years ago, Pho So 1 was my go to spot for Vietnamese food. Their bo nuong vi and all other dishes, soup are still the same. Completely new modern, clean look and great customer service.
Delicious Pho in Vegas! Perfect comfort food and great service! I will definitely come back with my family and more friends!!! YUMMY!!!

This is one of the good Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas. We came in at lunch time on Saturday but we didn't have to wait for the seats. The employees is fast and helpful. I like the food here. In general, it looks clean, good food and helpful staffs. (4.5 stars)

The pho here was good but they have definitely raise their prices up. The inside of the restaurant definitely looks nicer and cleaner. I ordered a pho to go here and the flavor of pho was good. They have more items you can order here but I haven't tried it. This will probably be one of my to go spots for pho

I went here when I first moved to Vegas when it was under its old management and it was good in its own right. It's now changed mostly in terms of menu items, and it's still very good. 

We got the beef with woven rice noodles, raw beef salad, egg rolls, charbroiled pork, salted lemonade, salted plum drink, and che ba mau.

The beef with grilled nicely with some char markings and you wrap it in the lettuce, pickled carrots/daikon radishes, mint, and woven rice noodles. The flavor was on point, a little salty from the meat but you get a nice freshness from all the veggies. They have the hot water and spring wraps in a little unit which makes it so much easier to hydrate it. 

The egg rolls were pretty standard but had a nice crunch to it. It kind of reminds me of when my mom used to fry it up at home. You know, **~*nostalgia~*~*


The raw beef salad was probably my favorite thing we got there. It's fresh, vibrant, and you get this subtle acidity from the lime. All in all, a very solid dish and it's a plus because this dish is so hard to find in Vegas. Most places do your typical viet pho, rice, noodle soups, etc, but the new changes to the menu try to give more variety than your usual pho joint. It's trying to introduce you to more Vietnamese food that you may not know about, and for that, I'm so glad. As someone who was raised on Vietnamese food but sucks at cooking it, I'm thankful for Pho So 1 for expanding the menu.


Overall, it doesn't taste exactly like the old pho so1, but it definitely is good in its own different way. Don't knock it down because it's not exactly like the old joint. After all, things change and sometimes it's for the better.

Wow, I got to say this place has been gutted with all new furniture, which explains why they closed down.  When you walk in you feel welcom, it could be the attentiveness of the staff.  That doesn't stop at the door, they continue to check on you and ask if everything is fine.  Shocking right?!  That's a 180 degree turn from what I been used to at these establishments. 

So since service was on point, you all probably want to know how was the food.  Well, let me describe each with a small description.

Roasted hen with noodles - all I need to say is the flavor was non stop! A winner.

Roasted hen with tomato rice - kids loved it and it came with pickled daikon and carrots - YES!

Beef and broccoli with steam rice - healthy choice. Ok....

Rice plate with two items - egg meatloaf delish. Pork had alot of fat; bummer, planning to get the beef next time instead of pork.  

Will be back as this might be my regular stop again.
Wow, this place makes awesome pho here. The broth is so flavorful unlike other places I have tried in the past. Customer service was excellent, definitely will come back.

My hubby got the ox tail pho & by far it is one of the best pho broth i have tasted. Not oily at all. We also got the egg rolls which was filled with meat. I ordered the pork rice plate which i loved. I would definitely go back again. I like the wood seating.
Delicious pho soups here! Place is under new management do it looks nicer. Food is still yummy!

The original owners are back & I am so happy to see all the familiar faces.  The food is just as good as before. The interior has changed and the bathrooms are super clean. I love the decor! But here's what I recommend ordering:

Egg rolls with Fresh veggies *****

The pork vermicelli rolls*****
(Not a lot of restaurants have these rolls.)

 Table side grilled marinaded steak and seafood*********************** (extra good and so addicting)

Che ba Mau aka 3 color Dessert***** 


Living in Vegas for 20 years and I was sad to see them close for a few months but it was to renovate and improve. Looking forward to returning for more deliciousness!

Super yummy! We've been here quite a few times now. The #1 fried egg rolls are good as always. We usually get the chicken fried rice and #36 crispy fried noodles. The only thing I really don't like is that the plates are SUPER small. Literally. The portions come in big especially the noodles but to stir its so hard to stir them when your plate is tiny. The staff is really friendly and and the service is really quick. Definite must try!
Great Foods, Superior Services, Phenomenal Environment. Everything on the menus are um...um... good. Come check it out now.
Great atmosphere! Delicious foods! Generous portions! Very nice rustic industrial decor!  Highly recommend this joint!

I have been going to PS1 like forever (since I know it's existed) - every time I visit Vegas, this is 1 of my fav restaurants.  They just remodeled recently and I'm loving the new modern/neat look!!
Food is always amazing - I'd recommend their bo tai chanh salad (rare beef with lime juice salad), besides the pho and bun bo hue (my go-to comfort food).

I'm a picky Pho eater. As a Vietnamese, it is my duty to eat it at least once a week so I know Pho. This place is in my top 3 Pho place of all time, if not the top. The broth makes and breaks Pho. Everything else are just complimentary. This place makes the Pho broth that made my knees weak. I ordered the oxtail Pho. One taste and I was stunned how good it was. No need to add any sauce. It was perfect.

So happy that this place Reopened. When we first moved to Vegas 12 years ago this was our favorite pho spot! And still is! Newly renovated. New menu. Great atmosphere. 
We order the Pho Tai Nam, egg rolls and the Chicken Roti with egg noodles. Everything was delish!  My fav was the Chicken Roti (must try).  
Service was great! Waitress was very attentive. Food came out fast and piping hot. And Our water/tea glass was never empty lol. One of my pet peeve's

Quick & Dirty: I would confidently bring my parents to eat at Pho So 1 because they hit on how a restaurant should represent our people's food. (I don't say that very often about Vietnamese restaurants, too.) And other peeps feel the same way because I saw mad Viet families up in there, yo. lol. Asian to non-Asian ratio was like 15 to 1.

Things to know:
*****
I. LOCATION & PARKING: Find Pho So 1 in the center of a strip mall off the intersection of West Spring Mountain Road and South Decatur Boulevard (Chinatown). They have plenty of parking.

II. FOOD & DRINK: Sure, they have your rice plates, bowls of soup, and noodle dishes, but they have multiple iterations of each kind (something I've only seen in Cali and Houston). I tasted the following:

*Goi Cuon ($5.95): Pricey, but worth it. I tried both their bo nuong (charbroiled beef) and tom thit (traditional with pork and shrimps) and loved their on-point flavors. More importantly, though, their sauce had an ideal consistency and peanut buttery taste. 

*Oxtail Pho ($13.95): I don't prefer oxtail pho because I don't like the smell as much as shoulder or femur, but I tried theirs. And I liked it! They scoop the scum from the pot, which results in a clean, translucent broth.

I also like how one can order different sides. I asked for gan (tendon) and nam (flank). They cooked both very well. 

*Cafe Sua Da ($3.75): I would probably dock them a star for not bringing it out with the coffee drip and glass of ice, but I can't hate. It tasted both bold and sweet. Kiss me.

III. SERVICE: Fast. No problems there.

IV. AMBIANCE & DECOR: The newly renovated restaurant feels clean and modern, without losing its Vietnamese roots. Also, they have three different sections, and it seems like most of the tables can accommodate large families. 

V. PRICES: Most dishes cost less than $10. And for the amount of food one can get that's a lot of value.

VI. OVERALL: I think Pho So 1 gave me the best meal during my most recent Vegas trip. Thanks for steering me in the right direction, Yelp!

Bad customer service.
We are new to the city and want to have the Vietnamese food.
Of course the food here is not as good as California, but it is acceptable. 
However, the customer service here isn't excusable because the guy who helped us order today did not have good attitude. He asked us kinda rudely and seem like he did not have any patience.

My experience dining here wasn't the best. When I first arrived at the restaurant we were seated in the corner, which was fine. It wasn't until 20 minutes later when the waitress finally approached us for the first time after several attempts to get someone's attention. I understand that it was busy but there was no organization on which tables were covered by which server. I had ordered a ribeye steak pho with added beef balls. One woman approached me to let me know the ribeye was very frozen so I changed my order to a Special combination Pho. A minute later, my original server comes to tell me the same thing. Egg rolls come out first-- delicious. My bowl of Pho comes out after and I was pretty disappointed. I ordered the special combination and what I got was just the added beef balls from my original order and the noodles in broth.. nothing else. Communication was poor. Will not be eating here again.

The decor here is average to below average. Definitely not my thing.

The service is average to good.

The food is awesome. Best Pho I've ever tasted. Come back here often.
My family and I come here for their Bo nuong vi(bbq beef) best in town. The oxtail soup is amazing too.

Ordered the chicken pho! Was super delicious but should have ordered without the cilantro () haha the broth was amazing and the service was one of the best. The restaurant looked great very clean and well organized. Decor was tasteful as well.

This place has been around, and they just recently renovated the whole place, looks good now. The food has always been good here and they did need that place upgrade and it sure did made it a lot cleaner. With that said, its so much better to eat in a place that is clean and more space. I do recommend this place if you are feeling up to have some good 'ol PHo.
Its good! That's PHo sure! Happy noodling :)

All I can say is wow. I don't know if this place got new management but the service is now top notch and the entire interior was redone. Not only that but the food is bette than ever. This place had closed for a few months. Prior to that I had left a 1 star review. Great job and keep up the great food and service!

Pho So, Pho So le mio. Sta 'nfronte a te! Sta 'nfronte a te! (Trust me, sounds much better when Pavarotti sings it!!)

Wife wanted to try Las Vegas pho. I told her not to get her expectations up, because it wasn't likely that Las Vegas pho would be any better than Little Saigon pho, or real Saigon pho, for that matter. Probably better than Fargo pho, though. 

Pho So is in Las Vegas' Chinatown area, a little to the west of The Strip on Spring Mountain Road. It's in a crowded strip mall, and depending on where you enter or leave, what day and time it is, it can be a nightmare!! Took 10 minutes to back up and get out of the parking lot: about a total of 30 feet!! 10 freaking minutes!! Hell, real Saigon pho isn't worth that!!! Well, maybe if the waitress was naked....., but I digress!!

So we had a few spring rolls and some pho. The pho was so...so. Pho So had so so pho!! Get it? Bwahahahaha! Hold on, let me catch my breath! 

It's much like any Vietnamese pho restaurant, and I've been to a few dozen, in Little Saigon and real Saigon. And Phan Thiet also. About $27.50 went into decor, and maybe double that for furnishings. The food's decent, but seriously, it's not worth 10 minutes to move my car 30 feet. Treasure Island opened some pho place, and next time I told my wife we'd go there. The pho is probably half the quality at twice the price, and yes, it'll take 10 minutes to get there from the parking lot, but at least we're moving!!! Yes, some In-N-Out drive thrus take 20-30 minutes to get through, but dude!! In-N-Out!! It's worth it!! Pho So isn't. If you go, don't go during peak dining times.

It's sure been a while since my husband and I have been here. So happy to see the original owners are back! 
We had the nuong vi. We grilled beef and shrimp at our table and rolled it up. It was delicious. My toddler also loved the three-colored dessert! 
They renovated the place and it looks awesome. Great service. We will definitely be back!

Ate here on the 5th of May 2018 and i had great pho. As did my friends, but my wife... She got a bland bowl of noodles that tasted like it was very heavily watered down. Hence the 4 instead of 5 stars that I would have given this place. The meat here was good, the noodles were also really good, my broth was well above the average of pho places I've eaten. Despite my wife's pho, I'll likely return to eat here again and see if that was just a fluke.

My favorite Vietnamese restaurant  in Las Vegas. Staff is friendly and greet you right away.. restaurant is clean. Food is fresh. I always order vermicelli noodle with egg roll and shrimp and fresh spring rolls. By far the freshest but it's in china town so I don't visit often.

I absolutely loved the pho. The owner was very attentive and checked in on us a couple of times. Food is a little too salty but not too bad. I don't reccommend the salted lemonade though, I wanted to try something new but it was crazy salty.. not for me.

Besides that, the broth was amazing

I understand that it was busy that morning but the young waiter could've acknowledge us as we waiting for someone to take our order. We got there before the other table and he by pass us to take theirs. How rude!!
I just wanted some Pho' and get the hell out of there because there's other things on my agenda that day.
Ive been to many pho places ... but the taste of their broth doesnt top this place... pho so 1 broth is extreamly flavorful

I come here every time I visit and always get their spicy beef soup (bun bo hue). I haven't found a place that makes it as good as they do.  Portion is huge so I recommend sharing and they put tons of authentic meats in there which you never see anywhere else. Absolutely delicious!! They renovated since I was there last and it has a great modern and clean look. Great service as well. We will be back!
